instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
threads.message:
Liquid Damage Macbook retina 2015

green light no power 


ultrasonic cleaned and made sure it was dry 

plugged it in and while measuring smoke came out of the board

<TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> had a hole in it 

replaced it with 2013 board (slightly different part number) 

anyways same thing just the light nothing

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is not constant on L7560


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.57

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> was obviously dead and <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> is dead too likely. There is also a good chance the 3v3 bus went high due to the shorted FET. What is resistance to GND on L7560? Replace <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> if resistance looks ok.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
threads.message:
red prob on ground 
0.123 in diode 


0.6k in regular resistance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
threads.message:
pin 2 on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> is short to ground 

removed and still short

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
threads.message:
ok so i injected voltage to that pin and other connected components. nothing getting hot 

removed l7520 and short gone. i thought it was the coil. i was obviously wrong 
<SIGNAL>P5VS3_VSW</SIGNAL> had the short rail 

removed <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR> and short gone 

now replaced that, and <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> 

now getting 3.3v constant and cpu getting 1.7v 

but nothing on display with brand new battery plugged in 

feel so close but yet so far

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
threads.message: Yeah, my bet is on that 3V3 went high and killed stuff on that rail. Does a USB mouse light up when plugged in?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
threads.message: Bleh :(. Give the board a good inspection for corrosion, but I suspect 3V went high. There is so much stuff on the 3V rail that it is not practical to fix this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
threads.message: put on ultrasonic and now i hv light on mouse

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
threads.message: Is there an image? Check with flashlight to back of Apple logo to see if it is a backlight issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
threads.message:
No image. Solid black. 5v on the bklight

i know these things have low heat but not fan spin either

and Caps lock doesn't light up

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on 2015
threads.message: You mean 5V on L8300? Anything on <CAPACITOR>C8300</CAPACITOR>? Fan does not spin on these till they get pretty hot.
